intro: Cirsium jorullense var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy thistle, is a perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a robust root system and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in dry grasslands and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
